text: <a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-1/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-2/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 But even after that we had suffered before, and were shamefully entreated, as ye know, at Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God with much contention.
<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-3/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 For our exhortation *was* not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-4/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 But as we were allowed of God to be put in trust with the gospel, even so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, which trieth our hearts.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-5/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; God *is* witness:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-6/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Nor of men sought we glory, neither of you, nor *yet* of others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.
<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-7/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-8/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 So being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-9/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-10/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Ye *are* witnesses, and God *also*, how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-11/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 As ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a father *doth* his children,
<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-12/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 That ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-13/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye received *it* not *as* the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-14/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 For ye, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judaea are in Christ Jesus: for ye also have suffered like things of your own countrymen, even as they *have* of the Jews:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-15/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-16/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-17/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-18/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.

<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-19/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 For what *is* our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? *Are* not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?
<a href="../1-Thessalonians-2-20/" title="1 Thessalonians 2:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 For ye are our glory and joy.
